intro: Gomphostemma velutinum, commonly known as the velvetleaf gomphostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing shrub or vine, with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain several seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various animals. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
